members.name: Colour
members.brief: An intrinsic object that provides colour manipulation functionality.
members.description: Colours are represented by a hex code in the form of a number.

members.name: blend
members.brief: Blend the RGB values of colour A and colour B by interpolant t.
members.description:
When t = 0, colour A is returned.

When t = 1, colour B is returned.

When t = 0.5, the colour "between&q...

members.name: fromHSVValues
members.brief: Turn hue, saturation and value into a hex colour to use in drawings, platform shapes, etc.
members.description: The HSV values must be given in the form of an array ordered by [hue, saturation, value].

members.name: fromRGBValues
members.brief: Turn red, green and blue into a hex colour to use in drawings, platform shapes, etc.
members.description: The RGB values must be given in the form of an array ordered by [red, green, blue].

members.name: toHSVValues
members.brief: Get hue, saturation and value from a hex colour.
members.description: The HSV values will be returned in the form of an array ordered by [hue, saturation, value].

members.name: toRGBValues
members.brief: Get red, green and blue values from a hex colour.
members.description: The RGB values will be returned in the form of an array ordered by [red, green, blue].

members.name: game
members.description: An object that provides information about the game, both modifiable and unmodifiable, and methods that allow manipulating ...

members.name: audio
members.brief: A small collection of methods related to sounds.

members.name: events
members.brief: This object contains the only event-related method, addEventListener.
members.description: Read more about events here.

members.name: graphics
members.brief: A collection of graphics-related methods and parameters, such as drawings and camera manipulation.

members.name: inputs
members.brief: An array containing the inputs (keys and mouse info) of every player, ordered by player ID.
members.description: This also contains input overrides, under game.inputs.overrides.

members.name: lobby
members.brief: A collection of info about the room, including players and game settings.
members.description: This does not change at any point in the game. This means that people leaving/joining during a game will not affect the co...

members.name: prevState
members.brief: The game state corresponding to the previous step. Doesn't exist in the first step, so look out for that.

members.name: state
members.brief: A collection of info about the current state of a game, such as scores, player and map object attributes, etc.

members.name: vars
members.brief: Empty object where you can store anything, as long as what you're trying to store can be represented using only JSON types (number, string, etc).
members.description: Whatever you store in here will stay here until the game ends.

members.name: world
members.brief: A collection of methods and parameters related to the game world.
members.description: Such as raycasts, death barrier enabling/disabling, helper functions for creating platforms, etc.

members.name: debugLog
members.brief: Log a message into an in-game logbox for debugging.

params.description: The message to log. Can be a string, a number, an array, etc.

members.name: Vector
members.brief: An intrinsic object that provides vector mathematics functionality.
members.description: Vectors are represented by arrays of numbers. Example: [5, 2] is a 2d vector pointing at x: 5, y: 2.

members.name: add
members.brief: Adds the components of vector B to the respective components of vector A.
members.description: B can also be a number, in which case B is added to every single component of A.

members.name: distance
members.brief: Returns the distance between vector A and vector B.

members.name: divide
members.brief: Divides the components of vector A by the respective components of vector B.
members.description: B can also be a number, in which case, every single component of A is divided by B.

members.name: dot
members.brief: Returns the dot product of vector A and vector B.
members.description: If normalized vectors are given, the function returns 1 if they point in exactly the same direction, -1 if they point in c...

members.name: getAngle2d
members.brief: Get the angle between the 2d vector and (1, 0), taking the point zero (0, 0) as the rotation center.
members.description: This is the inverse of Vector.rotate2d([1, 0], angle).

members.name: length
members.brief: Returns the length (also called magnitude) of the vector.

members.name: lerp
members.brief: Returns a vector linearly interpolated between vectors A and B by the interpolant t.
members.description:
When t = 0, vector A is returned.

When t = 1, vector B is returned.

When t = 0.5, the vector midway between ...

members.name: multiply
members.brief: Multiplies the components of vector A by the respective components of vector B.
members.description: B can also be a number, in which case, every single component of A is multiplied by B.

members.name: normalize
members.brief: Returns the vector scaled to have a length of 1.

members.name: reflect
members.brief: Reflects a vector (dir) off the plane defined by a normal.
members.description: The normal vector defines a plane (a plane's normal is the vector that is perpendicular to its surface). The ...

members.name: rotate2d
members.brief: Rotate a 2d vector by a given angle, taking the point zero (0, 0) as the rotation center.

members.name: subtract
members.brief: Subtracts the components of vector B from the respective components of vector A.
members.description: B can also be a number, in which case B is subtracted from every single component of A.

members.name: drawingShape
members.brief: Definition of a (drawing) shape.

members.name: allowPosSending
members.brief: This variable controls whether this player can send their mouse position to the others in the room or not.
members.description: Input sending can cause lots of lag, specially for something like mouse position which has to be sent every time it change...

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the camera, in degrees.

members.name: E
members.brief: The mathematical constant e. This is Euler's number, the base of natural logarithms.

members.name: left
members.brief: true if the player is pressing the left mouse button, false otherwise.

members.name: LN10
members.brief: The natural logarithm of 10.

members.name: LN2
members.brief: The natural logarithm of 2.

members.name: LOG10E
members.brief: The base-10 logarithm of e.

members.name: LOG2E
members.brief: The base-2 logarithm of e.

members.name: Math
members.brief: An intrinsic object that provides basic mathematics functionality and constants.
members.description: This Math object is slightly different than the Math object you would see in a normal JavaScript environment. The two main...

members.name: middle
members.brief: true if the player is pressing the middle mouse button (the scroll wheel), false otherwise.

members.name: noLerp
members.brief: Determines whether any changes made to this drawing will be applied through a smooth transition (as smooth as your screen's refresh rate) or if they will be applied instantly (at 30fps). Resets to false every step.

members.name: PI
members.brief: Pi. This is the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter.

members.name: pos
members.brief: Position of the camera, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: pos
members.brief: Player's mouse position, in GMMaker units.

members.name: right
members.brief: true if the player is pressing the right mouse button, false otherwise.

members.name: scale
members.brief: Scale (zoom) of the camera, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: SQRT1_2
members.brief: The square root of 0.5, or, equivalently, one divided by the square root of 2.

members.name: SQRT2
members.brief: The square root of 2.

members.name: abs
members.description: Returns the absolute value of a number (the value without regard to whether it is positive or negative). For example, the ...

params.description: A numeric expression for which the absolute value is needed.

members.name: acos
members.description: Returns the arc cosine (or inverse cosine) of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression.

members.name: asin
members.description: Returns the arcsine of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression.

members.name: atan
members.description: Returns the arctangent of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression for which the arctangent is needed.

members.name: atan2
members.description: Returns the angle (in degrees) from the X axis to a point.

params.description: A numeric expression representing the cartesian y-coordinate.
A numeric expression representing the cartesian x-coordinate.

members.name: ceil
members.description: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to its numeric argument.

params.description: A numeric expression.

members.name: cos
members.description: Returns the cosine of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression that contains an angle measured in degrees.

members.name: exp
members.description: Returns e (the base of natural logarithms) raised to a power.

params.description: A numeric expression representing the power of e.

members.name: floor
members.description: Returns the greatest integer less than or equal to its numeric argument.

params.description: A numeric expression.

members.name: log
members.description: Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression.

members.name: max
members.description: Returns the larger of a set of supplied numeric expressions.

params.description: Numeric expressions to be evaluated.

members.name: min
members.description: Returns the smaller of a set of supplied numeric expressions.

params.description: Numeric expressions to be evaluated.

members.name: pow
members.description: Returns the value of a base expression taken to a specified power.

params.description: The base value of the expression.
The exponent value of the expression.

members.name: random
members.brief: Returns a pseudorandom number between 0 and 1.

members.name: round
members.description: Returns a supplied numeric expression rounded to the nearest integer.

params.description: The value to be rounded to the nearest integer.

members.name: sin
members.description: Returns the sine of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression that contains an angle measured in degrees.

members.name: sqrt
members.description: Returns the square root of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression.

members.name: tan
members.description: Returns the tangent of a number.

params.description: A numeric expression that contains an angle measured in degrees.

members.name: capZone
members.brief: Definition of a capture zone.

members.name: i
members.brief: ID of the capzone's fixture.

members.name: l
members.brief: Capture zone length, the value that p must reach to completely capture the zone.

members.name: o
members.brief: ID of the owner of the capture zone. If no one has entered it yet, this will be -1. When on teams, ot is used instead.

members.name: ot
members.brief: Owner team of the capture zone.
members.description:
• When ot == -1, no team is owner yet.
  • When ot == 2, Red Team is owner.
  • Wh...

members.name: p
members.brief: Capture completion/process.
members.description: It increases when only the owner/s are inside the capture zone, decreases when an opponent is inside, and stays still if n...

members.name: ty
members.brief: Capture zone type.
members.description:
• Type 1 is a normal capzone,
  • Type 2 is Instant Red Win,
  • Type 3 is Instant Blue Win,
  • Type 4...

members.name: collideWith
members.brief: Indicates what collision needs to happen for the event to fire: collision with a player, an arrow or a platform.

members.name: disc
members.brief: Definition of a disc.

members.name: a
members.brief: Angle in degrees of the disc.

members.name: a1a
members.brief: Special ability cooldown (Heavy on Classic, shooting arrows on Arrows, grappling on Grapple) in physics steps (30fps)

members.name: av
members.brief: Angular velocity of the disc.

members.name: da
members.brief: Arrow aim angle, in degrees.

members.name: ds
members.brief: Arrow aim speed (controls how fast an arrow will launch).

members.name: lv
members.brief: Linear velocity of the disc, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: ni
members.brief: Stands for "no interpolation", and works just like the noLerp variables in the camera and in drawings.
members.description: Setting this value to true will make the game not interpolate the player's movement until the next step. Useful for telepo...

members.name: p
members.brief: Position of the disc, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: slv
members.brief: Spawn linear velocity of the disc, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: sp
members.brief: Spawn position of the disc, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: swing
members.brief: Grapple joint information. Becomes null when the player isn't grappling anything.

members.name: team
members.brief: Team (1 = FFA, 2 = red, 3 = blue, 4 = green, 5 = yellow).

members.name: visible
members.brief: Determines whether the disc is visible or not.

members.name: discDeath
members.brief: Information about the death of a disc.

members.name: f
members.brief: The amount of steps that happened since the disc died.

members.name: i
members.brief: ID of the disc that died.

members.name: lv
members.brief: Linear velocity that the disc had when it died, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: m
members.brief: This number indicates the reason why the disc died.
members.description:
• If it's 1: the disc touched a death platform shape or a death arrow.
  • It it's 3: an opponent claimed a captu...

members.name: p
members.brief: Position that the disc had when it died, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: drawing
members.brief: Definition of a drawing.

members.name: alpha
members.brief: Alpha (opacity) of the whole drawing, from 0 to 1.

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the drawing, in degrees.

members.name: attachId
members.brief: An ID, used by the "disc" and "platform" attachment types.

members.name: attachTo
members.brief: Indicates what type of object this drawing is attached to. Whether it appears in front or behind the attached object is determined by isBehind.
members.description:
It can be either of these five types:

"screen" will attach the drawing to screen space, meaning camera mo...

members.name: isBehind
members.brief: Determines whether the drawing will appear in front or behind the attached object. If true, it will appear behind, otherwise, it will appear in front.

members.name: noLerp
members.brief: Determines whether any changes made to the drawing (excluding any shape changes) will go through a smooth transition (as smooth as your screen's refresh rate) or if they will be applied instantly (at 30fps). Resets to false every step.

members.name: pos
members.brief: Position of the drawing, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: scale
members.brief: Scale of the drawing, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: shapes
members.brief: An array containing all of the shapes that make up the drawing.

members.name: drawingImageRegion
members.brief: The visible region of an image. It allows you to only show a portion of the image, instead of showing it fully.

members.name: pos
members.brief: Position of the image region, in pixels, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: size
members.brief: Size of the image region, in pixels, as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: drawingShapeBase
members.brief: Properties that any (drawing) shape has.

members.name: alpha
members.brief: Alpha (opacity) of the shape, from 0 to 1.

members.name: colour
members.brief: Colour of the shape, in 0xRRGGBB format.

members.name: noLerp
members.brief: Determines whether any changes made to the drawing (excluding any shape changes) will go through a smooth transition (as smooth as your screen's refresh rate) or if they will be applied instantly (at 30fps). Resets to false every step.

members.name: pos
members.brief: Position (offset) of the shape, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: type
members.brief: Indicates what type of shape this is.

members.name: drawingShapeBox
members.brief: Box (drawing) shape specific properties.

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the box, in degrees.

members.name: size
members.brief: Size of the box, as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: drawingShapeCircle
members.brief: Circle (drawing) shape specific properties.

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the circle, in degrees.

members.name: size
members.brief: Size of the circle, as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: drawingShapeImage
members.brief: Image (drawing) shape specific properties.

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the image, in degrees.

members.name: id
members.brief: ID of the image.

members.name: region
members.brief: The visible region of the image. It allows you to only show a portion of the image, instead of showing it fully. Setting this to null will show the full image.
members.description: The main purpose of region is to select a specific sprite for a spritesheet, so no interpolation is done on the region's p...

members.name: size
members.brief: Size of the image, as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: drawingShapeLine
members.brief: Line (drawing) shape specific properties.

members.name: end
members.brief: Position at which the line ends, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: width
members.brief: Width (thickness) of the line.

members.name: drawingShapePolygon
members.brief: Polygon (drawing) shape specific properties.

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the polygon, in degrees.

members.name: scale
members.brief: Scale of the polygon, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: vertices
members.brief: The vertices that make up the polygon, represented as 2d vectors.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: drawingShapeText
members.brief: Text (drawing) shape specific properties.

members.name: align
members.brief: Determines the position of the text anchor. Can be "left", "center" or "right".

members.name: angle
members.brief: Angle of the text, in degrees.

members.name: bold
members.brief: Determines whether the text is bold or not.

members.name: italic
members.brief: Determines whether the text is italic or not.

members.name: shadow
members.brief: Determines whether the text has a drop shadow or not. The shadow looks like the in-game player names' shadow.

members.name: size
members.brief: Size of the text.

members.name: text
members.brief: Content of the text shape.

members.name: gameAudio
members.brief: Methods that allow the mode to play and stop sounds.

members.name: playSound
members.brief: Play a sound with a specified volume and panning.
members.description: The ID corresponding to a custom sound can be changed in the Mode Settings menu. You can find a list with all of the vanil...

params.description: The ID of the sound to play.
Volume of the sound (0 to 1). You can play sounds with volumes higher than 1.
Panning (balance) of the sound (-1 to 1).

members.name: playSoundAtWorldPos
members.brief: Play a sound with a specified volume at a specified X position in the world.
members.description: The ID corresponding to a custom sound can be changed in the Mode Settings menu. You can find a list with all of the vanil...

params.description: The ID of the sound to play.
Volume of the sound (0 to 1). You can play sounds with volumes higher than 1.
World X position of the sound.

members.name: stopAllSounds
members.brief: Stop ALL sounds that are currently playing, including sounds made by bonk.io itself.

members.name: addEventListener
members.brief: Attach a function (listener) to an event. This function will be called when the event happens. An event can have multiple listeners attached to it.
members.description: Read more about events here.

params.description: The name of the event to attach the listener to.
Unique options to change when and how the listener will be called.
The function to attach.

members.name: gameGraphics
members.brief: Information, parameters and methods related to graphics.

members.name: camera
members.brief: Camera parameters, such as position, angle, scale (zoom), etc.
members.description: If any of these parameters is altered, arrows that indicate the location of offscreen players will stop being shown.

members.name: drawings
members.brief: Array containing every drawing, ordered by ID. You can modify or delete drawings from here, and they will update accordingly.

members.name: quality
members.brief: The quality option chosen by you, the one running the code, in the bonk.io settings menu.
members.description:
Quality is stored as a number: 1 is Low, 2 is Medium and 3 is High.

VERY IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ: Because it's y...

members.name: addShapeToDrawing
members.brief: Adds the given shape to a drawing. Any missing properties in the shape will be replaced with defaults.

params.description: ID of the drawing
Shape to add

members.name: bakeDrawing
members.brief: Bake a drawing into a single image shape.
members.description: This helps reduce lag by a lot, but the downside is that their shapes will no longer be modifiable.

params.description: ID of the drawing
Quality of the newly rendered image

members.name: createDrawing
members.brief: Creates a drawing with the data given. Any missing properties will be replaced with defaults.

members.name: getScreenSize
members.brief: Get the current screen size (in GMMaker units), as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.
members.description:
Read more about vectors here.

...

members.name: gameLobby
members.brief: Information about the current lobby (players, settings, etc).

members.name: allPlayerIds
members.brief: Array that contains all player IDs in use.
members.description: This list is static, so if a player leaves or another one joins, this will not change until next game.

members.name: clientId
members.brief: The player ID corresponding to you, the one running the code.
members.description: VERY IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ: Because it's your ID, the value of clientId is going to be different for every singl...

members.name: hostId
members.brief: The player ID corresponding to the room host.

members.name: playerInfo
members.brief: Array that contains lobby-specific attributes for every player currently alive, such as usernames, levels and skin colours.
members.description: Ordered by player ID (discs[0] is player with ID 0, discs[2] is player with ID 2, etc.)

members.name: settings
members.brief: Game settings set by the host of the game, such as the non-GMM mode and the amount of rounds needed to win.

members.name: gameSettings
members.brief: Game settings set by the host of the game, such as the non-GMM mode and the amount of rounds needed to win.

members.name: bal
members.brief: Array that contains the balance (nerf/buff) of each player. Ordered by player ID.
members.description: Players with 0% balance are not present here.

members.name: mo
members.brief: The non-GMM mode currently selected.
members.description:
Modes are internally represented by an ID:

  • "b" is Classic
  • "bs" is Simple

members.name: tea
members.brief: true if teams are on, otherwise false.

members.name: tl
members.brief: true if teams are locked, otherwise false.

members.name: wl
members.brief: Amount of rounds to win.

members.name: gameState
members.brief: Information about a game step.

members.name: capZones
members.brief: Array that contains varied attributes for every capture zone, such as the type of capzone and the fixture they possess.
members.description: Ordered by capture zone ID (capZones[0] is capzone with ID 0, capZones[2] is capzone with ID 2, etc.)

members.name: discDeaths
members.brief: Array that contains varied info about every recent death of a disc.
members.description: In GMMaker, the term "disc" refers to the physical manifestation of a player, in other words, the ball you contr...

members.name: discs
members.brief: Array that contains varied attributes for every disc currently alive.
members.description: In GMMaker, the term "disc" refers to the physical manifestation of a player, in other words, the ball you contr...

members.name: fte
members.brief: Likely stands for "frames 'till end".
members.description:
It's a timer number that indicates how many steps are left until the round ends and the world gets reset.

When fte ...

members.name: ftu
members.brief: Likely stands for "frames 'till unfreeze".
members.description:
It's a timer number that indicates how many steps are left until the world unfreezes and the players can start moving.

...

members.name: lscr
members.brief: Probably stands for something along the lines of "last scored".
members.description:
• On a Free For All game, it contains the ID of the player who just won the round.
  • On a Teams game, it indica...

members.name: mm
members.brief: Probably stands for "map metadata".
members.description: It contains a bunch of info about the map, such as the username of the person who created it, the name of the map, etc.

members.name: ms
members.brief: Likely stands for "map settings".
members.description: It contains several map-specific settings.

members.name: physics
members.brief: This is where map platforms and joints are stored.

members.name: projectiles
members.brief: Array that contains varied attributes for every arrow, such as their owner and position.
members.description:
Ordered by arrow ID (arrows[0] is arrow with ID 0, arrows[2] is arrow with ID 2, etc.)

It's unknown why Chaz named ...

members.name: rc
members.brief: Likely stands for "round count". It indicates how many rounds have passed since the game started (when the host presses START).

members.name: rl
members.brief: Likely stands for "round length". It's the amount of steps that have happened since last round start.

members.name: scores
members.brief: Array containing the amount of wins for each player/team.
members.description:
<ul>
<li>On a Free For All game, these scores are ordered by player ID and each one of them corresponds
public  to a player. ...

members.name: aliveDiscs
members.brief: An array containing the IDs of every disc currently alive.

members.name: angularSpeedCap
members.brief: The maximum angular speed that objects can reach. It's set to 2700 by default.

members.name: disableDeathBarrier
members.brief: When set to true, the barrier that kills players when they go offscreen is disabled.

members.name: linearSpeedCap
members.brief: The maximum linear speed that objects can reach. It's set to 60 by default.

The shape to be added. It's not necessary to specify every property of the shape here, any missing properties will be repl...

returns.description: The index at which the shape is located in the platform's shapes array.

members.name: clonePlatform
members.brief: Clone a platform.

params.description: The ID of the platform to clone.
true if joints attached to this platform should be cloned as well, false otherwise.

returns.description: The ID of the newly created platform clone

members.name: createArrow
members.brief: Create an arrow with the definition given. In your definition, you can exclude properties that you don't need to define at the moment and GMMaker will fill them in with default values.

returns.description: The ID of the newly created arrow

The platform to be created. It's not necessary to specify every property of the platform here, any missing properties will...

returns.description: The ID of the newly created platform

members.name: deletePlatform
members.brief: Delete the specified platform, and everything related to it, such as joints and capzone definitions. Drawings attached to the platform aren't deleted.

params.description: The ID of the platform to delete.

members.name: endRound
members.brief: End the round immediately, without showing the win screen.

members.name: getDiscRadius
members.brief: Get the radius of a disc (affected by balance).
members.description: If given the ID of a disc that doesn't exist, it will return 1, as that's the size value of a disc with 0% balance.

params.description: The ID of the disc.

params.description: Name of the platform to search for

members.name: rayCast
members.brief: Cast a ray from an origin point in the world to an end point.
members.description: The filter function's job is to indicate where the ray should stop and return the results. When the ray hits ...

params.description: The start point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
The end point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
Filter function that dictates at which point the ray should stop.

members.name: rayCastAll
members.brief: It's like a raycast, but it allows you to find multiple objects in the line.
members.description: When the filter returns true, the raycast doesn't stop, instead, it adds the hit info to an array that gets r...

params.description: The start point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
The end point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
Filter function that dictates what hits should be ignored and which shouldn't.

members.name: removeShapeFromPlat
members.description: Remove a shape from a platform.

params.description: The ID of the platform
The index of the shape to be removed

members.name: triggerWin
members.brief: End the round.
members.description:
If teams are off, the win will correspond to the player with the specified id.

If teams are on, the win will corres...

members.name: inputExtra
members.brief: Extra properties in game.inputs that aren't part of the array.

members.name: overrides
members.brief: An array containing input overrides for every player, ordered by player ID.
members.description: Each index (except those who don't belong to any player) contains six override keys: up, down, <...

members.name: joint
members.brief: Definition of a joint.

members.name: aa
members.brief: [Rotating and soft rod only] First attachment offset, as a 2d vector. Relative to the first attachment's platform.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: ab
members.description: [Rotating and soft rod only] Second attachment offset, as a 2d vector. Relative to the second attachment's platform. If th...

members.name: ba
members.brief: [Present in everything but gear joints] ID of the first platform attached.

members.name: bb
members.brief: [Present in everything but gear joints] ID of the second platform attached.
members.description: To make the joint have no second attachment, set this value to -1. Path and springy joints should also have it set to -1.

members.name: d
members.brief: [Present in everything but gear joints] A collection of diverse joint parameters.
members.description: It is unknown why Chaz decided to make a separate collection just for these properties.

members.name: ja
members.brief: [Gear joint only] ID of the first joint attached.

members.name: jb
members.brief: [Gear joint only] ID of the second joint attached.

members.name: len
members.brief: [Rotating and soft rod only] Max length of the joint.

members.name: n
members.brief: [Gear joint only] Name of the joint.

members.name: pa
members.brief: [Follow path joint only] Path angle in degrees.

members.name: pax
members.brief: [Follow path joint only] X offset of the joint.

members.name: pay
members.brief: [Follow path joint only] Y offset of the joint.

members.name: pf
members.brief: [Follow path joint only] Move force.

members.name: plen
members.brief: [Follow path joint only] Path length.

members.name: pms
members.brief: [Follow path joint only] Move speed.

members.name: r
members.brief: [Gear joint only] Gear ratio.

members.name: sax
members.brief: [Springy joint only] X offset of the joint.

members.name: say
members.brief: [Springy joint only] Y offset of the joint.

members.name: sf
members.brief: [Springy joint only] Spring force.

members.name: slen
members.brief: [Springy joint only] Spring length.

members.name: type
members.brief: Joint type.
members.description:
Can be:

  • "rv": A rotating joint,
  • "d": A soft rod joint,
  • "lpj":...

members.name: jointD
members.brief: A collection of diverse joint parameters.
members.description: It is unknown why Chaz decided to make a separate collection just for these properties.

members.name: bf
members.brief: Break force of the joint.

members.name: cc
members.brief: true if the attached platforms can collide, false otherwise.

members.name: dl
members.brief: true if joint line should be drawn, false otherwise.

members.name: dr
members.brief: [Soft rod only] Damping of the joint.

members.name: el
members.brief: [Rotating joint only] true to enable angle limit, false otherwise.

members.name: em
members.brief: [Rotating joint only] true to enable motor, false otherwise.

members.name: fh
members.brief: [Soft rod only] Softness of the joint.

members.name: la
members.brief: [Rotating joint only] Limit from angle in degrees.

members.name: mmt
members.brief: [Rotating joint only] Motor turn force.

members.name: ms
members.brief: [Rotating joint only] Motor max speed.

members.name: ua
members.brief: [Rotating joint only] Limit to angle in degrees.

members.name: guest
members.brief: Indicates whether the player is a guest account or not.

members.name: level
members.brief: The player's level.

members.name: skinBg
members.brief: Background colour of the player's skin.

members.name: skinColours
members.brief: All colours used in the player's skin.

members.name: team
members.brief: Indicates in what team the player is in.
members.description: 0 means the player is in Spectate, 1 means the player is in FFA, 2 means Red Team, 3 means Blue Team, 4 means Green Team, ...

members.name: userName
members.brief: The player's username.

members.name: mapMetadata
members.brief: Contains a bunch of info about a map, such as the username of the person who created it, the name of the map, etc.

members.name: a
members.brief: Map author's username.

members.name: dbv
members.brief: Lilely stands for "database version". Maps published in flash bonk.io will have dbv 1, while maps published in current bonk.io will have dbv 2.

members.name: mo
members.brief: Recommended mode for this map.
members.description:
Modes are internally represented by an ID:

  • "b" is Classic
  • "bs" is Simple

members.name: n
members.brief: The name of the map.

members.name: rxa
members.brief: Original map author's username. This is only present in edited maps. In completely original maps, it gets set to "" (an empty string).

members.name: rxdb
members.brief: Original database version (refer to dbv's description). This is only present in edited maps. In completely original maps, it gets set to 1.

members.name: rxn
members.brief: Original map name. This is only present in edited maps. In completely original maps, it gets set to "" (an empty string).

members.name: vd
members.brief: The amount of downvotes the map received.

members.name: vu
members.brief: The amount of upvotes the map received.

members.name: mapSettings
members.brief: Contains several map-specific settings.

members.name: fl
members.brief: Corresponds to the "Players can fly" option in the map editor.
members.description: It specifies whether discs can "fly" (like in fly maps) or not.

members.name: gd
members.brief: Map editor grid size. This property has no effect whatsoever on the game.

members.name: nc
members.brief: Corresponds to the "Players don't collide" option in the map editor.
members.description: It specifies whether discs can collide with each other (false) or not (true).

members.name: pq
members.brief: Corresponds to the "Complex physics" option in the map editor.
members.description:
For some reason, it's not a boolean, but a number:

  • When pq == 2, complex physics are used.
  • When pq !...

members.name: re
members.brief: Corresponds to the "Respawn on death" option in the map editor.
members.description: It specifies whether discs can respawn on death or not.

members.name: physShape
members.brief: Definition of a shape.

members.name: d
members.brief: true if this shape can kill players, false otherwise.

members.name: de
members.brief: Density of the shape. If set to null, the platform's density will be used here.

members.name: f
members.brief: Colour of the shape.

members.name: fp
members.brief: true if this shape can apply friction on players (Fric players), false otherwise.
members.description: If set to null, the platform's fric players will be used here.

members.name: fr
members.brief: Friction of the shape's surface. If set to null, the platform's friction will be used here.

members.name: geo
members.brief: The shape's geometry parameters.

members.name: ig
members.brief: true if this shape can be grappled from the inside, false otherwise.

members.name: n
members.brief: Name of the shape.

members.name: ng
members.brief: true if this shape can't be grappled, false otherwise.

members.name: np
members.brief: true if this shape is no physics, false otherwise.

members.name: re
members.brief: Restitution (bounciness) of the shape. If set to null, the platform's restitution will be used here.

members.name: physShapeGeometry
members.brief: Definition of a shape's geometry data.

members.name: a
members.brief: [Box and polygon only] Angle in degrees. Changing it does not affect polygons, as their vertices have already been affected by it beforehand.

members.name: c
members.brief: Shape offset. Changing this coordinate will have no effect on polygons, only on circles and boxes.

members.name: r
members.brief: [Circle only] Radius of the circle.

members.name: s
members.brief: [Box only] Size of the box, as a vector (x axis is width, y axis is height).

members.name: s
members.brief: [Polygon only] The scale of the polygon defined in the map editor. Changing this value will have no effect on the polygon.

members.name: sk
members.brief: [Box and circle only] Whether the shape will shrink or not.

members.name: type
members.brief: Geometry type.
members.description:
Can be:

  • "bx": A box (rectangle)
  • "ci": A circle
  • "po": A polygo...

members.name: v
members.brief: [Polygon only] The vertices that make up the polygon.

members.name: platform
members.brief: Definition of a platform.

members.name: a
members.brief: Angle in degrees of the platform.

members.name: ad
members.brief: The amount of angular drag on the platform.

members.name: av
members.brief: Angular velocity of the platform.

members.name: bu
members.brief: true if this platform has bullet physics (Anti Tunnel), false otherwise.

members.name: cf
members.brief: Object that contains the values of the three forces that get constantly applied to the platform: Apply Force X (cf.x), Apply Force Y (cf.y) and Apply Torque (cf.ct).

members.name: de
members.brief: Density of the platform.

members.name: f_1
members.brief: true if this platform can collide with group A, false otherwise.

members.name: f_2
members.brief: true if this platform can collide with group B, false otherwise.

members.name: f_3
members.brief: true if this platform can collide with group C, false otherwise.

members.name: f_4
members.brief: true if this platform can collide with group D, false otherwise.

members.name: f_c
members.brief: The collision group of the platform.
members.description: Instead of being represented by a letter, here it's represented by a number. That way, collision groups A-D are represente...

members.name: f_p
members.brief: true if this platform can collide with players, false otherwise.

members.name: fr
members.brief: true if this platform has a fixed rotation, false otherwise.

members.name: fric
members.brief: Friction of the platform surface.

members.name: fricp
members.brief: true if this platform can apply friction on players (Fric players), false otherwise.

members.name: fz
members.brief: Object that contains the force zone/field properties of this platform.

members.name: ld
members.brief: The amount of linear drag on the platform.

members.name: lv
members.brief: Linear velocity of the platform, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: p
members.brief: Position of the platform, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: re
members.brief: Restitution (bounciness) of the platform.

members.name: shapes
members.brief: Array that contains the shapes that constitute the platform.
members.description: NOTE: This is not an ordinary array! You can't manually add or remove shapes from this object. You must use the game...

members.name: type
members.brief: Platform type.
members.description:
Can be:

  • "s": Stationary,
  • "k": Kinematic,
  • "d": Dynamic (Free M...

members.name: visible
members.brief: Determines whether the platform is visible or not.

members.name: platformCollisionData
members.brief: Additional collision data that only platform collisions possess.

members.name: id
members.brief: ID of the platform hit.

members.name: normal
members.brief: A 2d vector with a length of 1 that represents the direction of the face hit by the other object.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: shapeIndex
members.brief: Index of the platform shape hit.

members.name: platformForceField
members.brief: Platform force field/zone parameters.

members.name: a
members.brief: true if this force zone affects arrows, false otherwise.

members.name: d
members.brief: true if this force zone affects discs, false otherwise.

members.name: on
members.brief: true if this platform is a force zone, false otherwise.

members.name: p
members.brief: true if this force zone affects platforms, false otherwise.

members.name: x
members.brief: X force applied on objects.

members.name: y
members.brief: Y force applied on objects.

members.name: platformForces
members.brief: Platform apply force parameters.

members.name: ct
members.brief: Amount of torque applied.

members.name: lf
members.brief: Amount of linear force applied in the X and Y axis.

members.name: w
members.brief: Indicates whether the force's direction is absolute (true) or relative (false).

members.name: playerInput
members.brief: Inputs (key/button press states and mouse position) of a player.

members.name: action
members.brief: true if the player is pressing heavy, false otherwise.

members.name: action2
members.brief: true if the player is pressing special, false otherwise.

members.name: down
members.brief: true if the player is pressing down, false otherwise.

members.name: left
members.brief: true if the player is pressing left, false otherwise.

members.name: mouse
members.brief: Mouse info, such as position and key states for the three mouse buttons (left, right and middle).

members.name: right
members.brief: true if the player is pressing right, false otherwise.

members.name: up
members.brief: true if the player is pressing up, false otherwise.

members.name: playerOverride
members.brief: Override keys for a player.

members.name: action
members.brief: Override for the player's action key.

members.name: action2
members.brief: Override for the player's action2 key.

members.name: down
members.brief: Override for the player's down key.

members.name: left
members.brief: Override for the player's left key.

members.name: right
members.brief: Override for the player's right key.

members.name: up
members.brief: Override for the player's up key.

members.name: projectile
members.brief: Definition of a projectile (arrow).

members.name: a
members.brief: Angle in degrees of the arrow.

members.name: av
members.brief: Angular velocity of the arrow.

members.name: did
members.brief: Player ID of the arrow's owner.

members.name: fte
members.brief: Likely stands for "frames 'till end".
members.description: It's a timer number that indicates how many steps are left until the arrow despawns.

members.name: lv
members.brief: Linear velocity of the arrow, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: ni
members.brief: Stands for "no interpolation", and works just like the noLerp variables in the camera and in drawings.
members.description: Setting this value to true will make the game not interpolate the arrow's movement until the next step. Useful for telepor...

members.name: p
members.brief: Position of the arrow, as a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: visible
members.brief: Determines whether the arrow is visible or not.

members.name: id
members.brief: ID of the object.

members.name: isCapzone
members.brief: [Platform type hits only] true if the shape hit is a capture zone, false otherwise.

members.name: normal
members.brief: A 2d vector with a length of 1 that represents the direction of the face hit by the raycast.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: point
members.brief: Point in space where the raycast hit the object. This is a 2d vector.
members.description: Read more about vectors here.

members.name: shapeIndex
members.brief: [Platform type hits only] Index of the platform shape hit by the raycast.

members.name: type
members.brief: Type of object hit by the raycast. Can be "disc", "arrow" or "platform".

members.name: statePhysics
members.brief: This is where map platforms and joints are stored.

members.name: bro
members.brief: Likely stands for "body (platform) render order".
members.description:
As the name may suggest, this is an array that determines the order at which platforms are rendered.

Each item cont...

members.name: joints
members.brief: Array that contains the definitions of every joint in the world.
members.description: Ordered by ID (joints[0] is joint with ID 0, joints[2] is joint with ID 2, etc.)

members.name: platforms
members.brief: Array that contains the definitions of every platform in the world.
members.description:
Ordered by ID (platform[0] is platform with ID 0, platform[2] is platform with ID 2, etc.)

NOTE: This is not an ord...

members.name: ppm
members.brief: Likely stands for "pixels per meter". It determines the size of the map: bigger ppm, smaller map.
members.description: Despite the name, a ppm of 1 will not make every meter a screen pixel wide, instead it will make them around 1.5 pixels wi...

members.name: perPlayer
members.brief: Indicates whether the listener will be called once, or if it will be called once for every player in the game.
members.description: The goal of this option is to facilitate self-interaction within a player, when needed (for example, to add new abilities,...

members.name: swingInfo
members.brief: Disc swing (grapple rod) information.

members.name: b
members.brief: Attached platform's ID.

members.name: l
members.brief: Grapple rod length.

members.name: p
members.brief: Grappling point relative to the attached platform's position.
